div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_clickable et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left

div.p: SCHOOL BUILDINGS CLOSED – CONTINUOUS LEARNING IN PROCESS

a.strong: Parent Resource Guide for Online Learning

span.b: For student chromebook repair, please email tech-help@usd253.net or call us at 620-341-2244.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_2 et_clickable et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left

p.span: Our district would like to gather feedback on USD 253’s response to COVID-19 and how we can best support each other. Please respond before the end of the day on Thursday, April 30, 2020. We will then take the top ‘Thoughts’ and address them in an online format the following week.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_sidebar_0 et_pb_widget_area et_pb_bg_layout_light clearfix et_pb_widget_area_left

menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-26511

div.p: Continuous Learning Plan: Vicki Schweinler Executive Director of Elementary Education and Wade Redeker Executive Director of Secondary Education reviewed the district’s Continuous Learning Plan outlining how the district will educate students for the remainder of the year Monday evening during the Emporia Board of Education meeting. The primary learning platforms will include the use of Google Classroom and student Gmail accounts as the key method for sharing class content and communicating with students and their families. Students who are unable to access the internet will be provided learning packets. Schweinler and Redeker each thanked everyone involved in developing the Continuous Learning Plan and putting it into motion. So many educators played crucial roles in creating opportunities for students to continue learning and complete their academic year.
The E. L. and Z. Irene Hopkins Foundation has established awards to recognize the outstanding performance of Emporia teachers and school support staff.

p.a: Learn more about the Hopkins awards

span.span: We build futures by preparing today’s students for tomorrow’s opportunities.

i.span: Foster a learning environment that demonstrates a balance of cognitive and social-emotional development.

span.span: Support the social-emotional development of our educational community.

i.span: Commit to meaningful communication between the district and stakeholders to foster trusting relationships and build a collaborative culture.

span.b: GOAL: Enhance communication and relationships with internal and external community members.

span.span: Engage in purposeful district-wide behaviors and activities that promote a positive culture.

i.span: Attract, retain, and develop high quality staff members who support our educational community.

span.span: Actively recruit, develop, and retain skilled, caring, and student-focused staff throughout the organization.

i.span: Provide appropriate infrastructure that meets the ongoing needs of the educational community.

span.span: Ensure an infrastructure that allows a safe and secure learning environment.
Provide learning spaces that meet the diverse needs of students and staff.
Building futures, one student at a time.

Emporia, KS 66801 - 1008

Emporia USD 253 does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion,
sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or genetic information.
Persons having inquiries may contact the school district coordinator in the Human Resources office.
